acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on rat dermal LD50: 5250mg/kg (RTECS (2005), HSDB (2005)), it was set as the outside of Category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on rat 4-hour inhalation LC50: 0.549mg/L (38.9ppm) (RTECS (2005), HSDB (2005)), it was judged as steam vapor pressure with this concentration. So it was classified as Category 1.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: It was set to as Category 4 based on rat oral LD50: 924mg/kg (Health, Labor and Welfare Ministry reports (2005)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Since there are no in vivo mutagenicity or genotoxicity study data on germ or somatic cells, and there is only negative data with in vitro mutagenicity test. So it cannot be classified.

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: The ignition points is 335 degC. (Hommmel (1991) Card No.215)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: There is the description that the eyes of the humans are stimulated (ICSC (J), (1995), HSDB (2005), SITTIG (47th, 2002), and DHP (13th, 2002)), and the description that in the rabbit, mild irritation was seen in the eyes (RTECS (2005), and HSDB (2005)). So it was set as Category 2A-2B.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was set as Category 2 from description that the skin of the humans was stimulated (ICSC (J) (1995), HSDB (2005), SITTIG (47th, 2002), DHP (13th, 2002)), and description that edema and bullous were seen within 24 hours by blocked applications of several hours with the rabbit (PATTY (4th, 1994)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement:
Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver, lung)
May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (thyroid)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on descriptions that effect was obsesrved at liver with dose from 20mg/kg/day and at thyroid with dose from 60mg/kg/day in the 28-day oral study of rats (the Health, Labor and Welfare Ministry reports (2005)); and that in the 100 to 106-day inhalation exposure test to rats, by 7-hour per day exposure of 14 ppm vapor , effect was observed in liver and lungs (PATTY (4th, 1994)), it wasclassified into Category 1 (liver, lung) and Category 2 (thyroid).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification:
Category 2 (central nervous system),
Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
May cause damage to organs (central nervous system)
May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale:
Description that the same disorder as a solvent induced encephalopathy was strongly suggested by the central nervous system function tests of the human acute evidence of exposure of HSDB (2005), and from description that central nervous systems manifestations was developed with the dose equivalent to Category 2 in the single-dose oral study in rats by the Health, Labor and Welfare Ministry reports (2005), and the rats single times mist inhalation studies of PATTY (4th, 1994), and these were judged that specific target organs were a central nervous systems, and it was set as Category  2.
From description of ICSC (J) (1995), SITTIG (47th, 2002), and DHP (13th, 2002) that the airway is stimulated, it judged that there was airway stimulativeness and was set as Category 3.
